subject: Re: [junit] Test Everything, No Matter How Simple
msgSnippet: I once got flack that some code that was generated from xml wasn t unit tested. So i updated the parser/generator to generate unit tests too. 100% coverage.

I once got flack that some code that was generated from xml wasn't unit tes=
ted.
So i updated the parser/generator to generate unit tests too.

100% co=
verage.

gigo

appell <simonpeterchappell@...> wrote:

  > > > So you're =
recommending 100% code coverage?
  > >
  > > So you're recommending 0% code=
 coverage?
  >
  >
  > Can you explain how you deduce this from my asking f=
or a simple

  It's my dry British hum=
our. You take a statement about testing
  everything and ask if that means =
he's recommending 100% code coverage;
  "everything" generally means 100%. =
So, I applied humour by absurdity
  and asked if you were recommending 0% c=
overage, that being the exact
  opposite thing.

  Simon
